origin:
When ‚Äúcentrists‚Äù care more about the GOP base than the Dem base, bigotry gets legitimized.

This is *the* playbook. GOP does it w/ virtually every Dem figure who isn‚Äôt a white male: otherize, demonize + splinter.

It‚Äôs vital that we adapt & dismantle this approach, not cow to it. https://twitter.com/DavidOAtkins/status/1107721283322540032¬†‚Ä¶
It's interesting to see centrists suddenly downplay or ignore the effects of racism, sexism and Fox News targeting when discussing @AOC's overall approval ratings.
replies:
We can‚Äôt gloss over it, or quietly consider that the ‚Äúshrewd‚Äù thing to do is nominate someone who won‚Äôt be subject to bigoted attacks.

Morally, we can‚Äôt give a pass to this dangerous tactic.

But even politically, the Dem base is all the people you demoralize by not standing up.

This is different than being moderate on policy. I may disagree w/ approach (keeping the ACA as-is w/small tweaks, etc), but at least that‚Äôs a policy convo.

But to make decisions based on the political efficacy of a bigoted argument gives that bigotry power, & that‚Äôs a problem.

I'm a centrist Democrat who detests bigotry. You're creating a strawman. Don't demonize the Democratic party in the same self-hating way that legions of far left Democrats like Bernie have over the past 6 years...
The Democratic party threw Ilhan Omar under a bus for criticizing AIPAC. When it comes to standing up to bigotry, Democratic centrists have repeatedly fallen short. This is not a strawman.
No, they criticized Omar for repeatedly saying anti-Semitic things.
Except that nothing she said was actually anti-Semitic, they just didn't like her pointing out the ridiculous amount of influence money has on our politics.
She is a huge supporter of BDS. They call for the abject destruction of the State of Israel, not a two state solution, the destruction of Israel.

Yes, how dare Israel have to play by the same rules as the rest of the world? All these things aside, why is it that perceived anti-Semitism is somehow worse than the actual rampant islamophobia in this country?
Because half a century ago, ‚Äúperceived‚Äù anti-Semitism lead to the gassing of 6 million human beings. We‚Äôre pretty insistent that not happen again.

That still doesn't explain why people only care when Jews feel attacked. There are many other groups that are unfairly targeted, yet the only one with people clamoring to defend is Jews. Sounds to me like you are helping prove her "hypnotizing the world" comment was accurate.
You‚Äôre an idiot. I can defend Jews and Muslims at the same time. For example, Perino‚Äôs comments were evil.

I never said you were incapable of defending multiple groups, I was simply pointing out that people (not specifically you) are getting more worked up over defending Jews than any other group that gets attacked. Also name calling when you can't win an argument is still pathetic.
If we need to explain why we get a little upset when our Jewish friends are attacked, I can‚Äôt help you. This shouldn‚Äôt be a identity olympics. Don‚Äôt be anti-Semitic and all is good. Easy.
Exactly, it shouldn't be an "identity olympics", so start caring about other groups that get attacked and stop using inaccurate labels already.
Defending anti-Semites isn‚Äôt a good look.
Only caring about one group of people when they feel threatened is worse.
Not caring about a group being threatened? I can care about many groups. That you don‚Äôt care about Jews is all we need to know.
As far as I'm concerned, when Fox News attacks you, you gain points in my book. To me, it's the biggest compliment any rational politician can be given.
QuancyClayborne EdKrassen AOC gops PAWarnhoff AngharadBond nazani14 RachelOsiris
Extraordinary how many trolls were attracted to this tweet. Usually it takes an anti-ammosexual tweet to bring out this level of nuckle-dragging muzzle-sucking ignorance.
JohnRMoffitt QuancyClayborne EdKrassen AOC gops PAWarnhoff AngharadBond nazani14

She scares them like Hillary did, doc. 

She did a class speech last week, and talked about fighting upward, not between ourselves.

She's a walking cliche that screams racism/sexism anytime her elementary understanding of things is called into question.  That's why people don't like her.

TaliaCat3 RachelOsiris JohnRMoffitt QuancyClayborne EdKrassen AOC gops PAWarnhoff AngharadBond nazani14

I think the criticisms are of her putting her boyfriend on the payroll, taking money from sketchy sources, and the same general crap all politicians pull off while claiming to "speak truth to power".  You're being duped.

One could, of course, make that argument... However, Trump tips the scale!! Can you even IMAGINE if so many of Obama's close associates, including his personal attorney, were headed to prison? Or if Obama had defended Putin over his own DOJ in front of the world??

Obama attempted to put journalists in jail, used the IRS to go after conservative groups, sent a massive pallet of cash to a terrorist state, and it's becoming pretty clear used the DOJ to protect Hillary and spy on Trump. Spare me the outrage.

Obama, and every other President in my lifetime (including Reagan. Research his history with Central America), abused power and had corruption. But none even comes close to what we are witnessing now.
Centrists *are* Republicans, just more careful and polished when they speak.

Strange seeing centrist as dirty word. Its a massive broad brush to list all centrists as Republicans. Many of them are democrats who agree with what @AOC said and have no problem voting for nonwhite men, as the 2008/2012 elections showed. We seem to be redefining the term. Why?

the reason why centralist is a dirty word is that it's wearing "The status quo" as the highest ideal and seeks compromise on topics where there is no wiggle room for that. For example how do you have a compromise on police brutality and misconduct? There is no middle ground.

Yeah, this is what I'm referring to by redefining centrism.  I don't support Police Brutality-lite, any more than I support minor Muslim bashing. This is a redefinition of the term as crazy right-wing-lite.  Call it "that" if you like. Centrism does not equal status quo.

Centrists are generally defined as the people who will throw marginalized groups under the bus to avoid scary confrontation/change. Martin Luther King called them out as the biggest threat to civil rights.

He said ‚Äúwhite moderates‚Äù not centrists. The terms are not interchangeable.  

I do feel like people are changing the meaning of terms midstream on folks. But I do agree that many people in the middle are there because they think change can‚Äôt happen. Doesn‚Äôt make them republican.

Centrists as a term is also associated with stability, and support for institutions and governance processes. When stability is threatened, centrists look for solutions. They tend to want evolutionary vs revolutionary change. Depending on the context though, this too is fluid.

My biggest disappointment of 2016 is that many who stayed home or voted against HRC did so because they weren‚Äôt inspired or she wasn‚Äôt progressive enough for them.

I‚Äôll never understand why folks wouldn‚Äôt play defense.  Some went for the Hail Mary and the other side routed us.

EXACTLY!!! You really have to wonder how many of these folks crowing about purity on the left had the exact same stance during the last election. 

There is no case that can be made for not voting for Hillary (was the case in 2016 also). This is why we have Trump today.

I guess you simply don't understand how urgent things are.  HRC was not an answer to this urgency.  She played a large role in why things have become so urgent.  She is a centrist; might as well be a Republican!

Once she was the nominee she was the only viable answer. And of course I understand urgency - I‚Äôm a black woman. I live out that urgency every day.  

But again - folks went for the half court shot when a tip in shot would‚Äôve worked.

If HRC had become POTUS, the liberals and the centrists would have gone back to sleep, just as they slept through Obama's 8  years.  With Trump, they have awoken---even if they still mistakenly think establishment Dems are the answer.  (They definitely are not!!)

Now this I partly agree with you on - but I‚Äôve been woke since birth (I‚Äôve had to be - I‚Äôm black). So I do worry about this. 

But I‚Äôm not sure getting here this way was worth the lives lost for no healthcare, the kids separated at the border and 2 horrid SCOTUS picks.
And the losses on climate control, gun control, etc.
FashionMaven88 MoralOutrage1 NoelDickover Writer_in_Black Adalore1 AOC
And the 40 years it may take to correct this mess - look at our courts.
The asshole you‚Äôre quote RT‚Äôing blocked me for defending President Obama, so you keep kissing his ass & you‚Äôll be out of a job.
Yeah sure - FoxNews is the problem with all of America (sarcasm) pic.twitter.com/eL3YDNGLTa

Here is the far left not missing the opportunity to dive into a bubble of their own thinking for warmth and cold comfort 

God forbade there is an actual moment of self realization that twitter ain‚Äôt real life and neither is cable news.
By the way - see this pic.twitter.com/6q9Q9j1h7Z
What's that I see? The two socialists, AOC and DeBlasio are underwater.

I don‚Äôt know if DeBlasio a socialist but he is a blowhard. How you going to be courting Amazon and telling them you are boycotting Amazon. 

No he is dumbass https://www.google.com/amp/s/amp.businessinsider.com/nyc-mayor-bill-de-blasio-says-amazon-boycott-continues-2018-11¬†‚Ä¶
He's a super duper, king of the Progressives. That makes him a socialist in my book.

He tries to have it both ways. 

It makes him look spineless. And NYers hate that the most. 

He is an executive so pragmatism has to be their rule.  But he thinks because he is a blue state he is going to play ‚Äú woke‚Äù dreams and that is infuriating.

I live just outside of NYC. DeBlasio is no stranger to me. He is at heart a socialist. But he recognizes that he can't run NYC strictly as a socialist. However, any new social program he can get away with, he'll do. If it means upstaging Cuomo's progressive bonafides, he'll do it

Now do you understand why women that supported @HillaryClinton get so angry when certain white, male politicians say identify politics don't matter only economic inequality? #BananaRepublicans pic.twitter.com/spkBYtazul

"Centrists" are people like your colleague @RepDavids. People who run for the district they live in. 

Why do you think you have any experience to speak on what wins elections when the only claim to your seat is the result of a low-turnout primary in a D+23 district?
All she does is attack Rep. Davids.

Because Rep Davids was also elected to lead the party at the federal level from Kansas. Leadership was thrust on her, and she rose to the occasion. AOC barely registers as a member of NY‚Äôs delegation

‚ÄúCentrist‚Äù is a term of the past. The GOP has shifted with this current administration so much that traditional conservative beliefs are virtually unrecognizable. For a ‚Äúlefty‚Äù, I consider myself fairly pragmatic, but not now, not when it‚Äôs raining frogs.
This! I keep telling everyone that the GOP has shifted the goal posts and they look at me like I'm crazy.
The GOP has stayed stagnant since 2010, whereas Democrats have gone radically to the left.
This is factually untrue. The Democrat shift left is nowhere near scale of the far-right shift of the GOP. Especially accelerated since the 100th Congress. (1987 onward). pic.twitter.com/td642UvknT

I think you should use the modifier "some' when you use the term "centrists". Just as some people attack people for being progressive it is dangerous to generalize.

I consider myself a center aligned independent. Fiscal conservative. Social left leaning moderate. The older I get the more left my views get labeled since the older I get the farther right the country drifts. It needs to move back to the left. My views on prejudice of any kind

My views on prejudice of any kind are as much based on the negative impact they have on society as a whole as they are on the fact that they are not right. As Dr. King said it should be a question of character. Like the people I served with in the Marines who were likely gay.

Bullets don't go looking for targets of a particular persuasion. Can you do the job. Don't generalize. If you do you are guilty of the same sort of grouping and prejudice as you claim to want to eliminate.  Besides, you are going to need "some" centrists to remove trump.
